info.title: Discounts
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: You want to create a 5% first time buyer discount for quotes that you send to new customers.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the discounts API to create and manage discounts that can be included in quotes.

post.summary: Read a batch of discounts by internal ID, or unique property values

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived

post.description: Returns a collection of discount objects matching the specified IDs or property values

get.description: Read an Object identified by `{discountId}`. `{discountId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param.  Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object type

delete.description: Move an Object identified by `{discountId}` to the recycling bin.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of an Object identified by `{discountId}`. `{discountId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will be ignored. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object type

post.summary: Archive a batch of discounts by ID
post.description: Returns confirmation of successful archival for the specified discount objects
Returns the newly created discount objects with their assigned IDs and properties
Returns the results of updating multiple discount objects, including success status and any errors encountered.

get.description: Read a page of discounts. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived

post.description: Create a discount with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID. Documentation and examples for creating standard discounts is provided.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of discounts by unique property values
post.description: Returns the results of creating or updating multiple discount objects by unique property values.
Returns a collection of discount objects matching the specified search criteria and filters.
